comments:
Newest dev build from today. Entering a new bug for Mylar (bug #180288: Error: "Error reading JIRA repository configuration cache" in org.eclipse.mylar)
gives this error if I pressed [Search for Duplicates]. The new task does not display in "My bugs and Comments" named search.

Starting with the new dev build, this search is marked with the small yellow warning-triangle:

	Last Error: I/O Error occured communicating with https://bugzilla.eclipse.org/bugs

It seems that this build is unusable... it worked before with 2.0M1.

Created an attachment (id=62555)
Same error in Error log

Submitting this bug I could the same error again.

- Switched back to Mylar 2.0M1
- Exported complete Task List.
- Reconfigured Eclipse to current dev.
- Stopped Eclipse.
- Deleted .mylar directory.
- Started Eclipse with new dev build enabled.

---> same behaviour

Created an attachment (id=62569)
tcpdump covering the complete synchronization to bugs.eclipse.org

This tcpdump covers the complete synchronization of my bugzilla query.

In the end, you can see 3 x RST (Reset) from the local computer. So I guess that Mylar aborted the connection.
Joerg: could you please update to the latest dev build (2.0.0.v20070330-1600) and see if you're still getting this error?

All of the errors reported above should be fixed (in particular failed notification bug#180263). Regarding yellow icon, check that your credentials aren't missing. Also note that socket timeouts have been increased for M3 (which can lead to the yellow warnings) but should report that timeout occurred.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Joerg: could you please update to the latest dev build (2.0.0.v20070330-1600)
> and see if you're still getting this error?

Mik, I did upgrade to the 2.0.0.v20070330-2000 (this is 2.0M2, isn't it?). Now it works like a charm

Many thanks and keep up the great work! The GUI changes with the nice pictures are very pretty.

J?rg

(In reply to comment #5)
> All of the errors reported above should be fixed (in particular failed
> notification bug#180263). Regarding yellow icon, check that your credentials
> aren't missing. Also note that socket timeouts have been increased for M3 (which
> can lead to the yellow warnings) but should report that timeout occurred.

Now it works. So I guess my credentials weren't missing.

Replying to this comment, I found that the "Reply"-arrows disappeared after submit and re-appeared
after some opening, closing, changing windows...
Shall I report this as a bug??
